titleStmt.title: A curious collection of original paintings, and other fine copies, by the best masters of Europe, will (for the divertisement of the gentlemen and ladies at Epsom) be exposed to sale by auction (or who bids most) on Monday, the 4th day of August, 1690 At Tonsor's Old Tavern ner [sic] the Old Bowling-Green in Epsom; which sale will be continued, during the season, on such days in the week as shall be thought most convenient. By Ferdinando Verryck, auctioneer, at Exeter-Exchange, in the Strand, London. Catalogues may be had at the place of sale: at the Coffee-house near the Bowling-Green: at the Coffee-house over against the Crown Tavern: at the Coffee-house at the Wells: at Tonsor's Tavern: and at the Crown Tavern in Epsom. Conditions of sale. I. That he or she who bids most is the buyer, ... IV. That the paintings may be viewed at any time before the sale, by any persons that please to repair thither.
titleStmt.author: Verryck, Ferdinando.
